definition: Self-Strengthening Movement (period of reforms in China c 1861-1894), also named 自強運動|自强运动
ocean/vast/foreign/silver dollar or coin
affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means
to move/to transport/to use/to apply/fortune/luck/fate
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: After "The Second Opium War", the Westernization movement has developed.
sentences.chinese: 第二次鴉片戰爭後，洋務運動興起。

sentences.english: Westernization Movement is the process in which some Chinese with advanced knowledge explore how to modernize China.
sentences.chinese: 洋務運動是部分先進的中國人探索中國近代化的過程。

definition: foreign affairs (in Qing times)/foreign learning

comprador
the New Culture Movement (mid-1910s and 1920s), intellectual revolution against Confucianism aiming to introduce Western elements, especially democracy and science
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad

to resist the enemy
